person.persName: Thomas Todd (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and politician)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and politician. Lincoln County, Kentucky, native. Son of Charles S. Todd and Letitia Shelby Todd. Married to Jane Smith Todd on January 14, 1841. Father of Charles S. Todd and Henry S. Todd. Married to Susie H. Jacobs Todd on October 21, 1851. Married to Elizabeth D. Bonney on May 10, 1860. Father of Katherine S. Todd, C. D. Bonney Todd, Bessie V. Todd, Charles S. Todd, and Letitia S. Todd. Captain in the 3rd Kentucky Regiment in the Mexican-American War in 1847. Member of the Masonic Order in Kentucky from 1842 to 1909. Member the House of Representatives of the Kentucky General Assembly in Shelby County in 1850. Managed his mother's Stockdale farm, with his brother Shelby Todd, buying it outright in 1858. Owned eight enslaved persons in 1860.
